overlay_h.intro_Txt: An overlay image is a static image superimposed over the video image. An overlay can be used to e.g. provide extra information, or to mask a part of the video image.
overlay_h.use_select_Txt1: To use an overlay image in the Axis product, it must be selected from the drop-down list of available images. The overlay (e.g. a logo) is then displayed in the video image.
overlay_h.use_select_Txt2: To use your own image, first upload it to the product by entering the name of the file in the field provided, or by clicking the Browse button and locating it. Then click the Upload button.
overlay_h.use_select_Txt3: Once your own image has been uploaded it will be available for selection from the use overlay image drop-down list.
overlay_h.scalable_txt: Scalable image overlay provide a means to automatically scale down the overlay image to fit the resolution that is used by the Axis product.
overlay_h.formats_Txt1: The uploaded image must be Windows 24-bit BMP (full color) format. The size of the overlay image in pixels (width by height) must be exactly divisible by 4.

overlay_h.placement_Txt1: The width / height needs to be a multiple of 4.
overlay_h.placement_Txt2: The image needs to be a 24bit BMP.
overlay_h.placement_Txt3: The maximum number of individual colors in an image is 250.
overlay_h.placement_Txt4: The maximum number of pixels (width by height) is 135000
overlay_h.placement_Txt5: Example: If an image has width 352 pixels and height 353 pixels. The size of the image will be 352 x 353 = 124256 pixels. But since the height 353 pixels is not evenly divisible by 32, transparent pixels will be added (padding) to make the height 384 pixels, meaning that the size of the image will be 352 x 384 = 135168 pixels. This image cannot be used as overlay image because its size is bigger than the maximum size that can be used (135000 pixels).
overlay_h.placement_Txt6: If the image overlay and text overlay are larger than the video image, no overlay will be displayed. When also using a text overlay, this will occupy 16 or 32 pixels in height (depending on the resolution) and as many in width as the video image. Please consider this when configuring the overlay image.
overlay_h.vSformats_Txt: When using the 2CIF format, overlays (both text and image) will be scaled vertically by the client on the Live View page or in a media player. Images in the 2CIF Expanded format are scaled directly in the server. See also the Image settings.
overlay_h.position_Txt: If the overlay is initially positioned so that part of it is outside the video image, it will be relocated so that it appears over the video image, i.e. it is always the entire image that is displayed.

transparency_h.helpTxt1: Colors in the overlay image can be made transparent. The options available depend on the type of image being used.
transparency_h.helpTxt2: When using a full color overlay image (a 24-bit BMP), a single color can be defined as transparent. To make a color transparent, check the box Use transparency and then enter the RGB hexadecimal value for that color, using the format RRGGBB.
transparency_h.scalable_overlay_txt: Check the Scale with resolution box for the overlay image to automatically be scaled down to fit the resolution that is used by the Axis product.
transparency_h.helpTxt9: When using a 16-color overlay image (a 4-bit BMP), each color can have its own individual transparency setting. The available settings are:
transparency_h.helpTxt10: Opaque - The color is displayed normally, i.e. it is not transparent and the background video image is obscured.
transparency_h.helpTxt11: Semi-transparent - The color is mixed with the background video image, which is partially visible.
transparency_h.helpTxt12: Transparent - The color is completely transparent and the background video image is fully visible.
transparency_h.helpTxt13: Note that transparency settings can only be applied once to each uploaded image. To change the transparency for an image, upload it again and then make the new settings.
